CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The device configuration was ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 30 nm ) / polymer : acceptor ( 80 nm ) / LiF(0.7 nm ) / Al(100 nm ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS (30 nm) |
| polymer : acceptor (80 nm) |
| LiF(0.7 nm) |
| Al(100 nm) |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities are identified as ITO, PEDOT : PSS (30 nm), polymer : acceptor (80 nm), LiF(0.7 nm), and Al(100 nm). These entities are precisely the same as the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| polymer : acceptor |
| LiF |
| Al |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities are identified as ITO, PEDOT : PSS, polymer : acceptor, LiF, and Al. These entities are precisely the same as the original paragraph, with the removal of any additional specifications (such as the thickness of the layers) that do not clearly refer to a material name.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The device configuration was ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 30 nm ) / polymer : acceptor ( 80 nm ) / LiF(0.7 nm ) / Al(100 nm ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS (30 nm) |
| polymer : acceptor (80 nm) |
| LiF(0.7 nm) |
| Al(100 nm) |

In this paragraph, the "Property Name" entities refer to the different layers of the device configuration. Each layer is identified by its material name and thickness.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| polymer : acceptor |
| LiF |
| Al |

In this revised list, I have removed the thickness specifications for each layer, as they do not refer to material properties. The resulting list includes only the material names as the "Property Name" entities.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS (30 nm) |
| polymer : acceptor (80 nm) |
| LiF(0.7 nm) |
| Al(100 nm) |

In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities refer to the specific materials and their corresponding thicknesses used in the device configuration. Each entity is mentioned as it appears in the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 30 nm |
| 80 nm |
| 0.7 nm |
| 100 nm |

In this revised list, the "Property Value" entities refer only to the specific thickness values mentioned in the original paragraph. These values are associated with the materials used in the device configuration.
